title: Sync'ing Google Contacts and CardDAV error
content:
I am trying to add my Google Contacts as an address book in Thunderbird so that I can sync my contacts, but I get an error in the process. Below are the sterps I've taken.

I go into my address book and add a new contact list. After I select Add new CardDAV address book and enter my username in the field. Thunderbird automatically fills in the location. I select next.

A web window opens asking me to sign in with my Google account. I enter my email address and click next. This is when I get the error 

"400. That’s an error.

The server cannot process the request because it is malformed. It should not be retried. That’s all we know."

The URL in the sign-in is quite complex with many parameters and referrers, but I am hesitant to post it here as it includes email addresses and other encoded information that I do not wish to get scraped.

Any ideas?

FYI: I did try CardBook, as many other posts refer to it, but I could not figure it out in a couple of minutes, so I need to read the documentation. But I would like to get the integrated solution working without the add-on if I can.
creator: michaelbelew

Is this a known bug, or if there are any workarounds available?

Best regards, Jason

title: Empty trash option missing in right click menu
content:
Hello,

I wanted to empty the trash in one of my email accounts in Thunderbird. Normally I would right click on the trash folder and then there is the option to empty the trash. Unlike ever before and on this one account (gmx imap) this option doesn't exist anymore - I can't empty the trash. I went into the account settings and ticked the option to empty the trash on exiting but after quitting Thunderbird and restarting it, the email is still in the trash.

What's wrong here? My suspicion is that I would need to mark the email in the trash as read and only then I would get back the option to empty the trash? I don't want to do that, I want to be able to empty the trash whenever I want to or on exiting Thunderbird. I don't want to be forced to mark an email as read before beeing allowed to delete it. Please help.

By the way, it was very difficult to even get to post this question here. I also don't really find this forum to be user friendly. Is this supposed to be the official Thunderbird forum? Or is that somewhere elese? Thanks.
creator: chris.brueckner

title: Account setup
content: Have 3 machines with Tbird, and 3 email accounts. During a password change for one account, TBird hammered the server enough times to get my IP blocked. Have been unable to complete the 3 setups without the ip getting blocked, have contacted the server support 4 times for unblocking. Why has Tbird made this so difficult? Used to be very easy! I want to do setup manually, and limit the number of times the setup tests the config.

title: Do not see Local Folders under Profile clik on newly downloaded Thunderbird
content:
I am trying to copy and paste from my old HP Envy laptop the Local Folders that have 3 email accounts onto my new HP Spectr allinone laptop. Toad Hall helped me in the past to recover all of the emails from being changed from POP to IMAP as directed by Comcast support. All is working perfectly fine with all of the comcast emails within 3 accounts under Local Folders.

The issue now is I just downloaded Thunderbird onto my new HP Spectre and followed Toad's suggestion: Now to locate those folders

windows search type : %Appdata% Select %Appdata% file folder Select the 'Roaming' folder Select the 'Thunderbird' folder Select the profile name folder Select the 'Mail' folder Select the 'Local Folders' folder

But there is no 'Mail' folder and no 'Local Folders' folder at all. I did find it under the profile name with release and tried to paste the Local Folders but when I launched Thunderbird there was nothing appearing under Local Folders under Account Settings. The path for Local Directory said:

Local Directory: C:\Users\Fred\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\4e3....default (not showing 100% of the profile name for security purposes) There is no \Mail\Local Folders appearing.

I did copy 3 Comcast Local email folders from the HP Envy onto my external hard drive of the sbd folders. Inside each of the sbd folders are the Inbox, Sent and Trash files

All of the 3 Comcast emails setup on IMAP were successfully setup and all of the emails were received. So that part is working perfectly fine.

I just need help getting all of the Local Folders pasted from the old HP Envy to the HP Sprectr laptop.

Thank you to all of you for any help you can offer on this!
creator: FredricJLowe

title: Rebuilding Global Database
content:
Due to problems searching my entire collection of email folders I am about to follow advice found here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database.

The how-to in the cited article is clear and easy to understand, but since I am mucking with my entire email history, and because the re-indexing process is so universal, I want to have a backup plan in case something goes wrong .... a way of getting my Thunderbird resources back to the state they were in before attempting to re-index the resources stored in the TBird globabl database.

Can I just save a copy of my entire Tbird profile before attempting the rebuild ... and restore it if something goes wrong in the rebuild. (Are there resources in, say, .../Library/Application Support that also would need to be backed up?)

For reference: my macos is up-to-date Sequoia, 15.6.1 and Tbird version 142.0

title: Sending Email.
content:
Hi,

It seems that the last upgrade has broken something with sending emails. With my desktop version, I have no trouble sending and receiving emails. I am using version 142.0 (64-bit) of Thunderbird, and the desktop computer is Windows 10.

I have 2 issues sending emails.

First issue, my Pixel 9 Pro XL does not send emails anymore. It was working fine until recently. The email is stalled in the outbox. I tried reloading the outgoing server settings, I get an error message; see attached error message. My Android receives emails fine, but will not send them. My phone syncs well with my desktop. However, the outbox doesn't sync, so I can't send the stalled emails from the desktop when I'm back in my office.

Second issue is my POS program (Windward Software System 5) stopped sending out emails as well. I worked with the tech department at the software company, and they said it isn't an issue with them, nothing has changed with them, no upgrades or changes on their end. Some of our older machines here, that haven't received the recent upgrade with Thunderbird, are still sending emails fine. Just a couple of computers are having this trouble of not sending emails from out POS software, it's the ones that have received the Thunderbird upgrade. For the outgoing settings, we are using the default port 465, and the connection security is SSL/TLS. Authentication method: is a normal password. I am hoping you have an answer for me. Please don't share the attachment with the community forums. Everything else will be fine.

Thank you,

Kathi McNally
creator: kathi15

title: Cannot dismiss reminder or set the snooze.
content:
Cannot dismiss reminder or set the snooze. Get the following:

Status Code: 2147500037, The request cannot be processed.

An error occurred when writing to the calendar charles.novak@gmail.com! Please see below for more information.

Server Replied with 400 If you're seeing this message after snoozing or dismissing a reminder and this is for a calendar you do not want to add or edit events for, you can mark this calendar as read-only to avoid such experience in future. To do so, get to the calendar properties by right-clicking on this calendar in the list in the calendar or task view.
